SUMMARY: Iran and Russia have signed an agreement to integrate their countries' respective banking systems in order to bypass Western sanctions.

SUMMARY: A tanker transporting liquefied natural gas suffered a malfunction and broke down in the southern part of the Suez Canal. However, traffic was not interrupted.

SUMMARY: A team of 15 policy commissioners led by EU President Ursula von der Leyen traveled to Kyiv, Ukraine, on Thursday. They hope to boost relations with the country.

SUMMARY: Two shootings, which occurred nine miles apart, killed a combined 10 people. Investigators are working to determine whether the shootings were connected.

SUMMARY: After lifting the majority of COVID restrictions, Hong Kong is launching a "Hello Hong Kong" tourist campaign. The city is offering free air tickets to tourists around the world.

SUMMARY: Four Russian Diplomats have been ordered to leave Austria, according to the country's government. The diplomats have been given a week to leave.

SUMMARY: The U.S. Military seized methamphetamine and hashish amounting to over $33 million after halting a supposed fishing vessel in the Gulf of Oman this week.

SUMMARY: Countries in Africa that have been dealing with cholera outbreaks are struggling to get access to vaccines. Africa's CDC is working to create vaccine manufacturers.

SUMMARY: The population of the West Bank in Israel has reached over 500,000. The West Bank's population has risen nearly 16% over the past five years.

SUMMARY: Israeli and Palestinian militants exchanged shots on Thursday. Israel intercepted a rocket from Gaza, and than an Israeli aircraft struck a workshop in the Gaza Strip.

SUMMARY: Maltese journalists are raising an alarm about the state of free speech in Europe as they face prosecution for interviewing a Christian who talked about leaving the LGBT lifestyle.

TITLE: Key witness testifies in trial for former Mexican public safety chief Genaro García Luna
SUMMARY: A witness in the trial for the former Mexican safety chief Genaro Garcia Luna claimed to have delivered millions of dollars in payoffs. He didn't discuss what the money was buying.

TITLE: China calls US 'trigger-happy' on defending airspace after 'objects' shot down
SUMMARY: The People's Republic of China's Ministry of Foreign Affairs took jabs at the U.S. on Monday, calling the country "trigger-happy" to shoot down aircraft.

TITLE: Reporter's Notebook: A week of up-close horrors and heroics in the Turkish earthquake zone
SUMMARY: Greg Palkot senior foreign affairs correspondent for Fox News reports from the worst areas in Turkey that were devastated by last week's earthquake.

TITLE: Australian police searching for 3 men after $165 million of cocaine washes ashore along with capsized boat
SUMMARY: Police in Australia are looking for 3 men they believe were involved in a smuggling operation gone wrong that resulted in a massive amount of cocaine washing up on shore.

TITLE: Dutch fighter jets intercept three Russian military aircraft near Poland, escort planes away
SUMMARY: Two Dutch fighter jets intercepted a formation of Russian military aircraft that were flying near Poland on Monday, defense officials reveal.

TITLE: Reporter's Notebook: Italian support for Ukraine on the wane according to recent poll
SUMMARY: Former Italian Prime Minister Silvio Berlusconi caused a firestorm in Europe over comments critical of Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy. His words come as a recent poll found support for Ukraine dropping in Italy.

TITLE: Ukraine killing nearly 1,000 Russian troops every day, eliminates 5,000 in single battle
SUMMARY: Ukrainian forces are killing nearly 1,000 Russian troops every day, and they eliminated 5,000 troops in a single battle in late January, according to U.K. officials.

TITLE: Taiwan's Defense Ministry says it will shoot down any suspected Chinese spy crafts, military objects
SUMMARY: Taiwan's Defense Ministry says it will shoot down any suspected Chinese military objects. Taiwan has yet to find any targets that required a lethal response.

TITLE: Qatar plans to send 10,000 cabins, caravans from World Cup to provide shelter for Turkish earthquake survivors
SUMMARY: Qatar will donate mobile homes which were used for the World Cup to Turkish earthquake survivors. The nation will send 10,000 caravans and cabins for the survivors to use as shelters.

TITLE: Gunmen storm Syrian hospital where baby born in earthquake rubble is recovering
SUMMARY: A hospital in Syria was stormed by gunmen on Tuesday. A baby who was born under the rubble of a recent earthquake is staying in the hospital that was invaded.

TITLE: Dutch court prohibits Netherlands' military police from racial profiling in identity check selection process
SUMMARY: The Hague Court of Appeals prohibited the Netherland's police from racial profiling during the selection process for identity checks. Two Dutch citizens sued the country's government.

TITLE: Good Samaritan in China climbs out window to save child dangling from building
SUMMARY: A man in China rescued a child who had climbed out of a window on a multi-story building and was dangling from the glass panel in Tangshan, China, last week, video shows.

TITLE: Thailand prime minister candidate hits campaign trail in Bangkok
SUMMARY: Deputy Prime Minister Prawit Wongsuwan has began campaigning to be the country's next prime minister. Prawit went to a series of locations in Bangkok to begin his campaign.

TITLE: Chinese leader Xi Jinping expresses support for Iran during meeting with Ebrahim Raisi
SUMMARY: Iran President Ebrahim Raisi visited China to meet with Chinese leader Xi Jinping. Jinping expressed his support for Iran during the leader's meeting.

TITLE: Kenya's president holds national day of prayer to end drought
SUMMARY: A national day of prayer is being held in Kenya with hopes that it will bring rain. The country has suffered from droughts for over five years.

TITLE: Romania's second earthquake in two days reaches 5.7 magnitude
SUMMARY: Romania's second earthquake, within two days, had a magnitude of 5.7 and a depth around 40km (25 miles), that was felt in the capital and the north.

TITLE: Congo reports 32 civilians killed by rebels, militias
SUMMARY: 32 civilians were reported dead in the Democratic Republic of the Congo's Ituri province following a series of attacks by rebel groups.

TITLE: Palestinian teenager fatally shot during Israeli army raid in West Bank
SUMMARY: A Palestinian teenager was killed in an Israeli army raid in a refugee camp in northern West Bank. The 17-year-old was fatally shot in the head after clashing with Israeli soldiers.

TITLE: Bus in northern South Africa involved in head-on collision with van; 20 dead
SUMMARY: A bus in northern South Africa was involved in a head-on collision with a van which caused 20 deaths and 68 injuries. The bus rolled down a hill into a river.

TITLE: UN calls for $397M in humanitarian aid for Syrian earthquake survivors
SUMMARY: The United Nations made a $397 million appeal Tuesday for humanitarian aid intended for Syrian survivors of the deadly earthquake which impacted both Turkey and Syria.

TITLE: Taliban forces kill 3 IS members in raid on Kabul building
SUMMARY: Taliban forces killed three IS members and arrested one in a raid on an Kabul building. This raid targeted and important hideout for the terrorist group.

TITLE: 5 German police officers charged over fatal shooting of mentally ill Senegal teen
SUMMARY: Five German police officers have been charged in an incident in which a Senegal teenager was fatally shot last year. The teen refugee had allegedly threatened to harm himself with a knife.

TITLE: US condemns Russian use of Iranian drones in Ukraine
SUMMARY: U.S. defense officials pointed Tuesday to photographs of unmanned Iranian aircraft being used by Russia in its war against Ukraine as proof of Tehran's involvement in the conflict.

TITLE: Pastor put in week-long solitary confinement for church service predicts Canadian revival: 'Something stirred'
SUMMARY: Pastor Phil Hutchings of Saint John, New Brunswick, recounted to Fox News Digital his week-long solitary confinement for holding church services and predicted revival in Canada.

TITLE: Israeli officials double down on settlement construction, rebuke US criticism
SUMMARY: Ultranationalist Israeli ministers deflected criticism on new settlements in the West Bank, and claimed friendship with US, EU, despite official objections to expansion plans.

TITLE: Egypt releases former anti-graft chief after 5 year prison stint
SUMMARY: Egypt has released former judge and anti-graft chief Hesham Genena from prison, where he was held for five years for disparaging the military.

TITLE: Romania, Moldova report potential UFOs in airspace
SUMMARY: Two potential unidentified flying objects were spotted about 36,000 feet above Romania and Moldova, sparking security concerns in the nations, both of which border Ukraine.

TITLE: Good Samaritan in Kazakhstan climbs out window to save child dangling from building
SUMMARY: A man in Kazakhstan reportedly rescued a child who had climbed out of a window on a multi-story building and was dangling from the glass panel.

TITLE: British thief admits to stealing nearly 200,000 chocolate Easter eggs
SUMMARY: British authorities say Joby Pool broke into an industrial park and stole $38,000 worth of Cadbury eggs and other chocolate products.

TITLE: French authorities find woman’s decapitated head, other body parts in public park: reports
SUMMARY: Municipal workers at a public park in Paris, France discovered a woman's decapitated head as well as other body parts this week, prompting an investigation.

TITLE: Florida men arrested for alleged roles in Haitian president's 2021 assassination: US DOJ
SUMMARY: Four Florida men were arrested on Tuesday in connection with the July 7, 2021 assassination of Haiti's President Jovenel Mois, according to the DOJ.

TITLE: US military shoots down Iranian-made drone over oil site in Syria
SUMMARY: The U.S. military shot down an alleged Iranian-manufactured drone on Tuesday as the military says it was conducting surveillance over an oil site in Syria.

TITLE: China ramps up surveillance, security threat with new satellite support from Antarctica
SUMMARY: China announced plans to develop new ground stations in Antarctica to support its satellite capabilities as concerns mount over Beijing's surveillance and security threats.

TITLE: Scottish leader Nicola Sturgeon to resign after 8 years
SUMMARY: Scottish First Minister Nicola Sturgeon announced her intention to resign after eight years of serving in the country's government and Scottish National party.

TITLE: New Zealand hit with magnitude 5.7 earthquake, no immediate reports of damages or injuries
SUMMARY: An earthquake struck near Wellington, New Zealand, on Wednesday. The earthquake was reportedly "widely felt in the North Island," but there were no reports of injury or damages.

TITLE: China threatens 'countermeasures' against US entities after spycraft shootdown
SUMMARY: China is considering undisclosed "countermeasures" in response to US entities responsible for shooting down a Chinese surveillance aircraft on Feb. 4.

TITLE: China expresses support for Sri Lanka ahead of lenders meeting
SUMMARY: China, one of Sri Lanka's biggest creditors, expressed support for Sri Lanka ahead of a meeting regarding the nation's debt. China has offered a two-year suspension of repayments.

TITLE: China's top diplomat meets with French President Emmanuel Macron to start off Europe trip
SUMMARY: Wang Yi, China's top diplomat is traveling to Europe amid tensions between the United States and China. Yi met with French President Emmanuel Macron on Wednesday.

TITLE: US ambassador to Japan has full confidence Japanese government will ban discrimination against LGBTQ people
SUMMARY: Sexual minorities in Japan are campaigning for the government to ban discrimination against LGBTQ people. The U.S. Ambassador to Japan has "full confidence" the government will do so.

TITLE: Police in Switzerland evacuate Parliament after a man bearing explosives arrested near the entrance
SUMMARY: A man bearing explosives was found standing near the entrance of Switzerland's Parliament. The country's Parliament and related offices were evacuated.

TITLE: Jordan's foreign minister vows to deliver earthquake aid during meeting with Syrian President Bashar Assad
SUMMARY: Ayman Safadi met with Bashar Assad in Damascus. The Jordan foreign minister vowed to deliver earthquake aid to Syria after the country was hit with a 7.8 magnitude earthquake.

TITLE: Speculation swirls around North Korea leader Kim's daughter after prominent appearance: Is she his successor?
SUMMARY: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un has raised the public profile of his young daughter, bringing her on tour with him and even enshrining her image on postal stamps.

TITLE: Captain of boys' soccer team rescued in Thailand cave in 2018 dead at 17
SUMMARY: The captain of the Thai boys' soccer team that was rescued from a flooded cave in a daring operation in 2018 has died in England at age 17.

TITLE: Human rights group calls out Oberlin College professor over alleged role in cover-up of massacre of Iranians
SUMMARY: Amid the nationwide protests in Iran, a new report claims a former Iranian ambassador to the U.N., now a professor at Oberlin College, allegedly covered up a massacre by the regime in 1988.

TITLE: Reporter's Notebook: Iran regime insider says it's time for rule by ayatollahs to end
SUMMARY: One of the founding fathers of Iran recently called for an end to the Islamic regime. Under house arrest, former PM Mir-Hossein Mousavi smuggled out a message that was highly critical of the regime.

TITLE: Russian reporter gets 6 years for disparaging her country’s military amid war with Ukraine
SUMMARY: Maria Ponomarenko, a Russian journalist, was sentenced to six years in prison for “spreading false information about the Russian armed forces’ actions” in Ukraine.

TITLE: Ukrainian farms eligible for funding through United Nation's International Fund for Agricultural Development
SUMMARY: Small farms in Ukraine will be eligible for funding through the United Nations' International Fund for Agricultural Development. The small farms play a big role in feeding the country.

TITLE: US ambassador to Japan has 'full confidence' Japanese government will ban discrimination against LGBTQ people
SUMMARY: Sexual minorities in Japan are campaigning for the government to ban discrimination against LGBTQ people. The U.S. Ambassador to Japan has "full confidence" the government will do so.

TITLE: Sweden pledges to send artillery cannons to Ukraine 'as soon as possible'
SUMMARY: Sweden will send artillery cannons to Ukraine "as soon as possible." Ukraine is counting on further Western military aid to repel Russian advances in the eastern part of the country.

TITLE: 73 migrants presumed dead after inflatable rubber vessel wrecks near Libya
SUMMARY: Dozens of migrants went missing and were presumed dead after a rubber boat deflated off the coast of Libya, a dominant transit point for those seeking better lives in Europe.

TITLE: China threatens 'countermeasures' against US entities after spy craft shootdown
SUMMARY: China is considering undisclosed "countermeasures" in response to U.S. entities responsible for shooting down a Chinese surveillance aircraft on Feb. 4.

TITLE: Former Italian Premier Berlusconi acquitted in trial tied to sexually charged ‘bunga bunga’ parties
SUMMARY: Silvio Berlusconi, a former Italian Premier, was found not guilty of witness tampering in a trial tied to sexually charged “bunga bunga” parties he held near Milan.

TITLE: UK police identify man found with no memory of who he is but more questions remain
SUMMARY: Police in England say they have established the identity of a man who was found wandering around a seaside town with no memory of who he is or where he came from.

TITLE: North Korea reduces soldier food rations for first time in decades, South says
SUMMARY: As North Korea may be on the brink of a food catastrophe, the country has begun rationing food to soldiers for the first time in more than two decades, officials say.

TITLE: Panama bus collision leads to at least 39 migrant deaths
SUMMARY: At least 39 migrants died Wednesday morning in a bus crash in western Panama. The bus driver collided with another vehicle which led to the bus rolling off a cliff.

TITLE: Initial earthquake aid delays blamed on Syria's Assad, warring factions and bureaucracy
SUMMARY: Syrians are in desperate need of humanitarian relief, but President Assad's weaponization of aid and the U.N.'s bureaucratic slow rolling prove to be early roadblocks.

TITLE: Chinese retirees protest in the streets over health insurance cuts
SUMMARY: Retirees in China went to the streets in Wuhan and Dalian to protest a recent cut to their health insurance. Monthly allowances were cut from $38 to $12.

TITLE: Turkey faces post-earthquake water shortage, disease risks
SUMMARY: Turkey is facing a shortage of clean water after two deadly earthquakes damaged the region’s sanitation infrastructure. The water shortage also increases the risk of disease outbreaks.

TITLE: European Medicines Agency expects annual COVID vaccination campaigns, similar to flu shot
SUMMARY: The EMA's head of health threats and vaccine strategy believes COVID-19 vaccination campaigns may be conducted once a year, similar to the flu shot.

TITLE: China shifts COVID origin blame after WHO abandons study into virus beginnings
SUMMARY: The People's Republic of China is dismissing accusations of impeding the World Health Organization's investigation into the origins of the COVID-19 pandemic.

TITLE: Michigan woman charged in college student's death to return to US after fleeing to Thailand
SUMMARY: The Michigan woman who fled the United States to Thailand after allegedly hitting a college student with her car on New Year's Day has agreed to come back to the United States.

TITLE: US parents ‘totally abandoned’ as Biden immigration policy fuels blockade on entry of adopted Haitian children
SUMMARY: Parents awaiting the arrival of adopted children from Haiti feel abandoned by the Biden administration as the State Department refuses to lift passport mandate amid migration crisis.

TITLE: ISIS official involved in planning prison breaks killed by US and coalition forces in Syria, CENTCOM says
SUMMARY: Ibrahim Al Qahtani, an ISIS official involved in planning prison breaks, was killed in a raid by U.S. and coalition forces on Feb. 10, CENTCOM announced.

TITLE: Two 15-year-olds charged with murder in fatal stabbing of TikTok teen Brianna Ghey
SUMMARY: Cheshire police in the United Kingdom announced on Wednesday that two 15-year-olds were charged in the murder of teen TikTok personality Brianna Ghey.

TITLE: South Korea refers to North as 'our enemy' for first time in six years as tensions heighten
SUMMARY: South Korea called North Korea its enemy in its biennial defense document, reviving the use of the label for the first time in six years and signaling rising tensions between the two.

TITLE: Africa's CDC hopes Mpox vaccines will arrive in 'another two weeks,' after months of seeking doses
SUMMARY: Africa is hoping to receive more Mpox vaccine doses in the next two weeks. The doses will be sent to countries with the largest overall Mpox burden first.

TITLE: Chinese parliament accuses US of violating sovereignty with spycraft response
SUMMARY: The People's Republic of China condemned Thursday the destruction of several aircraft shot down in US airspace, call it a form of 'political manipulation.'

TITLE: Russia-Ukraine war: Belarus will join fight if even 'one soldier' attacks territory, president says
SUMMARY: Belarusian President Alexander Lukashenko has pledged to join Russia in its invasion of Ukraine if even "one soldier" attacks a citizen of his country.

TITLE: Ukraine warns of massive Russian missile attack on anniversary of Putin’s invasion: ‘We have to be ready’
SUMMARY: Russia is preparing to fire a massive barrage of missiles into Ukraine on the one-year anniversary of Russian President Vladimir Putin's invasion of the country, Ukraine says.

TITLE: 'Most accomplished forger and fraudster' earned over $1M, treated thousands as phony psychiatrist
SUMMARY: Zholia Alemi, described as a “most accomplished forger and fraudster,” was previously jailed for trying to defraud a widow out of her £1.3 million estate

TITLE: China, Iran urge Afghanistan to end restrictions on women’s education, work
SUMMARY: In a joint statement, China and Iran called on Afghanistan to stop restricting women’s education and work. Since 2021, girls were banned from attending universities.

TITLE: Spanish parliament approves legislation expanding teen abortion rights, entitling workers to menstrual leave
SUMMARY: Legislation approved by Spain's parliament expanded transgender and abortion rights for teens in the country. The new laws also entitle workers to paid menstrual leave.

TITLE: Hong Kong population down for 3rd straight year as death toll from COVID-19 rises
SUMMARY: The population in Hong Kong has dropped for a third straight year during the pandemic. Many residents are also leaving in response to the erosion of Western-style civil liberties.

TITLE: Pakistan train explosion kills 1, injures 8
SUMMARY: A powerful train explosion in Pakistan has killed at least one person and injured eight others. Officers are still determining whether the disaster was caused by a bomb.

TITLE: Convicted killer nicknamed 'The Spider' busted trying to escape from prison disguised as sheep
SUMMARY: An inmate in Bolivia convicted of murder is back behind bars after trying to escape from prison by wearing a wool jacket and disguising himself as a sheep.

TITLE: China spy risks abound as VP Harris and senior US officials attend Germany security conference
SUMMARY: The Munich Security Conference also disinvited Russia and Iran in response to the continued invasion of Ukraine and Tehran's crackdown on nationwide protests.

TITLE: United Nations official says the Syrian death toll from earthquake is likely to rise
SUMMARY: The death toll from the earthquake in Syria last week is expected to rise according to a United Nations official. Teams across the country continue to remove rubble from affected areas.

TITLE: 6 killed in Egyptian crash involving a pickup truck, minibus near city of Ismailia
SUMMARY: A crash near Ismailia, Egypt, killed six people and injured three others. The crash involved a minibus and a pickup truck. Amongst the six dead were five Palestinians.

TITLE: Russian official's 'suicide' latest mysterious death that raises questions for Kremlin
SUMMARY: Another high-ranking Russian official has mysteriously died after appearing to fall from her 16th-floor apartment in St. Petersburg.

TITLE: France braces for a 5th day of nationwide protests over pension reform
SUMMARY: France is bracing for a fifth day of nationwide strikes over a proposed pension reform aimed at increasing the minimum retirement age by two years.

TITLE: Nigerian president defends country’s redesigned currency after swapping notes led to bank closures, protests
SUMMARY: President Muhammadu Buhari of Nigeria defended the country’s redesigned currency and said that swapping notes would help curb inflation and bolster the upcoming presidential election.

TITLE: Israel's foreign minister visits Ukraine, pledges financial aid
SUMMARY: Israeli Foreign Minister Eli Cohen said his country would provide financial aid to Ukraine. Cohen is the first senior Israeli official to visit Ukraine since the war with Russia began.

TITLE: Jamaican anti-corruption agency investigating the country's prime minister for potential conflict of interest
SUMMARY: Jamaica's anti-corruption agency is investigating Prime Minister Andrew Holness for his role in a potential conflict of interest case involving construction contracts.

TITLE: Thai soccer player rescued from flooded cave in 2018 died in England from head injury: report
SUMMARY: The captain of a boys’ soccer team that was rescued from a flooded cave in Thailand in 2018, who died Wednesday, suffered a head injury, reports say.

TITLE: Armed UK police storm KFC restaurant after 'youth' seen with weapon
SUMMARY: A witness called in, saying they had seen five youths with knives and guns inside the KFC, prompting an armed response from police, who also tasered one of the youths.

TITLE: Senegal police smash windows of opposition leader's vehicle, forcibly removing him
SUMMARY: The Senegal police smashed the windows of an opposition leader's car and forcibly removed him. Ousmane Sonko is being sued for public insults and defamation.

TITLE: Abused women find safety in Kenya refuge where men are banned
SUMMARY: Women escaping child marriage, domestic abuse, and genital mutilation are finding safe haven at a Umoja village where man are restricted.

TITLE: Nigeria seeks $1.3 billion in aid to deal with extremist violence
SUMMARY: Nigeria is seeking $1.3 billion in aid to combat the extremist violence that has hit the country. The violence has killed nearly 35,000 people and displaced at least two million.

TITLE: Iran believed to house suspected new al-Qaeda leader: UN report
SUMMARY: The UN has asserted that al-Qaeda has a new unofficial leader following the death of Ayman al-Zawahiri during U.S. air strikes in Kabul in July 2022.

TITLE: UK PM Sunak heads to Northern Ireland, fueling speculation of post-Brexit trade talks
SUMMARY: British Prime Minister Rishi Sunak traveled to Northern Ireland on Thursday, signifying that the U.K. may reach an agreement easing strained trade relations with the European Union.

TITLE: Boat carrying 71 Rohingya refugees lands in Indonesia
SUMMARY: A boat that was carrying 71 Rohingya refugees fleeing from refugee camps landed in Indonesia on Thursday. The refugees were escaping from Bangladesh due to inability to find work.

TITLE: 3 Iraqi soldiers killed during raid on suspected IS cell
SUMMARY: Three Iraqi soldiers have been killed in clashes with suspected Islamic State militants. The IS group member detonated an explosive vest during a raid on a suspected IS cell.

TITLE: Mexico to fast-track visas for Cubans with family already in country
SUMMARY: Mexico will open an expedited visa application process for Cuban migrants with relatives already living in the country, its Foreign Relations Department announced Wednesday.

TITLE: Japan discovers 7,000 new unknown islands after fresh survey
SUMMARY: Japan's official count of islands within the country's territory is expected to more than double after a new survey by the Geospatial Information Authority.

TITLE: UN pushes for $1B in funding for Turkish earthquake survivors
SUMMARY: The United Nations has launched a $1 billion appeal to ensure humanitarian aid for 5.2 million survivors of the earthquake that devastated Turkey and Syria last week.

TITLE: Colombian President Petro signs trade deal with Venezuela's Maduro on border
SUMMARY: Colombian President Gustavo Petro met with Venezuela's Nicolas Maduro to liberalize trade relations between the neighboring South American nations.

TITLE: China’s elite Peking University awards Iranian President Raisi ‘honorary professor’ title
SUMMARY: China's elite Peking University on Wednesday awarded Iranian President Ebrahim Raisi the title of "honorary professor" during an official state visit.

TITLE: North Carolina man developed 'uncontrollable' Irish accent during prostate cancer treatment
SUMMARY: A North Carolina man in his 50s developed an Irish accent 20 months into his treatment for prostate cancer despite never visiting Ireland or having immediate family from the country.

TITLE: What victory for Ukraine looks like beyond border security: chief defense adviser
SUMMARY: Top Ukrainian adviser to the defense minister lays out what victory for Ukraine would look like and how Kyiv's needs go well beyond border security.

TITLE: Chinese balloon found on Taiwan island, defense ministry says
SUMMARY: Taiwan says a Chinese weather balloon has been found on one of its outlying islands this week, following the discovery of a suspected Chinese spy craft that traveled over the U.S.

TITLE: Stunning Turkey earthquake rescues: Teen, new father saved 11 days later in 'true miracle'
SUMMARY: Turkish rescue crews have found two people alive around 260 hours after a 7.8-magnitude earthquake rocked the country and Syria on Feb. 6.

TITLE: North Korea threatens 'unprecedentedly' strong response to US-South Korean nuclear drills
SUMMARY: North Korea has threatened "unprecedentedly" strong countermeasures against recently announced drills between South Korea and the US focusing on Pyongyang's growing nuclear threat.

TITLE: North Sea storm causes train, ferry cancellations in Denmark, Norway
SUMMARY: Trains and ferries were cancelled in Denmark and Norway on Friday due to a storm over the North Sea. The storm is set to move east over Sweden and the Baltic Sea.

TITLE: Death toll from New Zealand cyclone reaches 8, over 4,500 people still unaccounted for
SUMMARY: Eight deaths have been recorded following a cyclone in New Zealand. Over 4,500 people are still unaccounted for four days after the disaster.

TITLE: Canada will send Navy vessels to Haiti in effort to quell gang violence in the island nation
SUMMARY: Navy vessels are being sent to Haiti from Canada. Gang violence has been a big issue in the island nation. Haiti's prime minister is pleading for international military intervention.

TITLE: Global bird flu alarm prompts countries to reconsider once-shunned vaccines
SUMMARY: After years of culling and locking up birds, farmers still see waves of deadly bird flu outbreaks. More and more countries are now reconsidering their previous opposition to vaccines

TITLE: Jamaican Prime Minister Andrew Holness will not face corruption charges in conflict of interest case
SUMMARY: Andrew Holness, the prime minister of Jamaica, will not face charges in a conflict of interest case from when he was the country's education minister.

TITLE: WHO calls for more funding to support health sector in war-torn Ukraine
SUMMARY: The World Health Organization appealed for more funding for war-torn Ukraine as the country struggles to provide adequate health services and medication.

TITLE: South African cheetahs begin journey to India as part of a plan to increase the country's big cat population
SUMMARY: A dozen cheetahs will be reintroduced to India from South Africa as part of an intergovernmental agreement to increase the country’s big cat population.

TITLE: European Union lawmakers condemn IOC's decision to set path for Russian athletes to compete in Paris games
SUMMARY: The International Olympic Committee has created a path for Russian and Belarusian athletes to compete in the 2024 Paris Games. EU lawmakers have condemned the IOC's decision.

TITLE: Japanese Prime Minister Fumio Kishida apologizes to LGBTQ community over former aide's remarks
SUMMARY: Japan's prime minister apologized to the LGBTQ community for remarks made by a former aide. The aide made a remark that he would not want to live next to an LGBTQ person.

TITLE: Russia to test hypersonic missile in drills with China, South Africa – a first for an international exercise
SUMMARY: Russia is scheduled to begin trilateral naval exercises with South Africa and China on Friday, with drills running through the one-year anniversary of the invasion of Ukraine.

TITLE: 4 US servicemembers injured during Syria raid that left ISIS senior leader dead
SUMMARY: The U.S. partnered with the Syrian Democratic Forces to carry out the raid, which also injured a "working dog," who is receiving treatment along with injured service members.

TITLE: 'Western agenda': Taliban ban sale of birth control, according to report
SUMMARY: The Taliban have already greatly restricted women's rights in Afghanistan, banning women from higher education and restricting access to public areas such as gyms and parks.

TITLE: Slovenia fireworks company explosion kills 1, injures 2
SUMMARY: An explosion at a Slovenia fireworks company led to the death of one person and injury of two. The explosion caused a fire inside the store on Friday. The cause of the blast is unknown.

TITLE: Former Afghan female lawmaker’s killer arrested by Kabul police
SUMMARY: Kabul security forces have arrested the man allegedly behind the killing of former Afghan female lawmaker Mursal Nabizada. Officials say the man confessed to the crime earlier this year.

TITLE: Spain orders extradition of British alleged hacker to US
SUMMARY: Spain's court has ordered the extradition of an alleged British hacker to the U.S. The British man was arrested on the coast of Spain for 14 different charges in 2021.

TITLE: 33 million children in sub-Saharan Africa vaccinated for polio
SUMMARY: More than 33 million children in several sub-Saharan African countries have been vaccinated against polio, according to the World Health Organization.

TITLE: FIFA allocates $1 million to those affected by the earthquakes in Turkey, Syria
SUMMARY: FIFA plans to provide humanitarian aid of $1 million to the millions of people who were left homeless from the destructive earthquakes in Turkey and Syria.

TITLE: Congo rebel group M23 killed at least 20 men, raped 66 women and girls, report says
SUMMARY: Militia M23 in Congo gang raped women and killed at least 20 men in November, according to Amnesty International. However, the rebel group denied the accusations.

TITLE: Bulgarian police find 18 migrants dead in abandoned truck
SUMMARY: Bulgarian authorities reported that 18 presumably Afghan migrants were found dead in the back of an abandoned truck after having suffocated to death.

TITLE: Heavily armed gunmen injure Filipino governor, kill 4 bodyguards
SUMMARY: Gunmen injured the Filipino governor Friday and killed four of his bodyguards during an attack on their convoy. Police have not released any information on the suspected shooters.

TITLE: Doctors Without Borders suspends Burkina Faso operations after fatal shooting
SUMMARY: International aid group Doctors Without Borders has suspended non-emergency operations in Burkina Faso after two of its staff were shot and killed there.

TITLE: Retaliating against Austria, Russia expels 4 diplomats
SUMMARY: Austria's recent expulsion of four Russian diplomats from Vienna has been met with retaliatory action by the Putin regime, which has now ordered four Austrian diplomats to leave Russia.

TITLE: Dog vs shark standoff thrills tourists on Bahamas boat tour
SUMMARY: Tourists on a Bahamas boat tour saw a dog dive off a dock into the water to swim after a massive hammerhead shark. The two animals circled each other until the shark swam off.

TITLE: North Korea fired ballistic missile into East Sea, South Korea and Japan says
SUMMARY: The Japanese and South Korean governments announced North Korea launched a ballistic missile into the East Sea on Saturday. The missile's flight path was not immediately clear.

TITLE: China representative invited to Taiwan by Taipei mayor met by dozens of protestors
SUMMARY: Li Xiaodong, Head of Shanghai city's Taiwan Affairs Office, was met by protestors at the Sunshan Airport in Taiwan after being invited to the self-ruled island by Taipei's new mayor.

TITLE: South Africa drills with Russia, China could signify failed Washington efforts to solidify African allies
SUMMARY: South Africa's naval drills with China and Russia suggest that Biden's effort to increase ties with African allies is faltering.

TITLE: Mexican candidates turn to migrants in US for votes: report
SUMMARY: Mexico has nearly 11 million nationals living abroad, the majority of them living in the U.S., with 2.5 million in Texas alone, according to estimates.

TITLE: US captures ISIS official after helicopter raid in Syria
SUMMARY: The U.S. Military confirmed on Saturday that it launched a helicopter raid in eastern Syria that captured a top ISIS official and resulted in no injuries or deaths.

TITLE: North Korea confirms ICBM test, warns of more powerful steps in response to South Korea, US trainings
SUMMARY: North Korea confirmed Sunday it did conduct another intercontinental ballistic missile test on Feb. 18 in efforts to further bolster its "fatal" nuclear attack against its rivals.

TITLE: Israel attacks Iranian targets in Syria as shadow war heats up between the two adversaries: report
SUMMARY: The reported Israeli attack against Iranian assets in Syria comes the same day that Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu confirmed an Iranian attack against an Israeli-registered ship in the Persian Gulf

TITLE: Parents demand answers after transgender woman plays cricket against girls as young as 12: 'Unacceptable'
SUMMARY: Multiple parents and coaches have expressed concern that allowing a middle-aged biological male to play cricket against girls as young as 12 is dangerous and inappropriate.

TITLE: Iran’s uranium processing has almost reached nuclear weapons-grade purity: inspectors
SUMMARY: International atomic inspectors say Iran has accumulated uranium enriched to 84% purity, just below what is needed for a nuclear weapon.

TITLE: Putin ally and Chechen leader Ramzan Kadyrov praises Wagner Group, says he'll create his own mercenary unit
SUMMARY: Ramzan Kadyrov, the leader of Chechnya and a key ally of Putin, praised the mercenary Wagner Group on Sunday and said he wants to start his own private military force.

TITLE: North Korea fires ballistic missiles after US conducts military drills with South Korea, Japan: 'firing range'
SUMMARY: One day after the U.S. held joint military drills with Asian allies, North Korea fired multiple ballistic missiles from its east coast, according to South Korea and Japan.

TITLE: Poland’s Duda to push Biden on increasing US presence in country amid Russia threat: diplomat
SUMMARY: Polish President Andrzej Duda is expected to push President Biden for more permanent troop placements in nations like Poland that border Russia or Ukraine to safeguard Europe's future.

TITLE: Ghislaine Maxwell mounts $10M appeal against 20-year sex trafficking sentence: report
SUMMARY: Ghislaine Maxwell reportedly reached a divorce settlement with ex-husband Scott Borgerson and secured the funds to mount a $10 million appeal to her sex trafficking sentence.

TITLE: Israel prison reforms would block convicted terrorists from making their own bread, cut shower times: report
