SUMMARY: Seismic tremors that shook Denmark with a magnitude of 2.3 were caused by an unknown source. The quakes were possibly triggered by controlled explosions in Poland.

TITLE: Israel, Cyprus working on deal to build natural gas processing plant, pipeline in Cyprus
SUMMARY: Cypriot Energy Minister Giorgos Papanastasiou announced that his country was working with Israel to build a natural gas pipeline and processing plant in Cyprus.

TITLE: Take that! Philippines sends China message on contested islands as tussle brews
SUMMARY: The Philippines have placed buoys around the Spratly Islands to counter Chinese aggression in the South China Sea. Beijing is accused of aggressively sending its ships into contested parts of the South China Sea.

TITLE: Western Slovakia crash between bus and truck kills 1, injures 59 others
SUMMARY: A western Slovakia crash between a bus and a truck killed one person and injured 59 others. The accident closed the D2 highway that links the Slovak capital with the Czech Republic.

TITLE: German prosecutors charge 4 men involved in far-right group with crimes of violence
SUMMARY: German authorities filed charges against four men who are alleged members of a far-right group, following an investigation targeting several of the organizations.

TITLE: Israel's UN ambassador calls for boycott of 'antisemitic event' at world body
SUMMARY: The U.N. is holding its first-ever Palestinian Nakba Day commemoration that alleges Israel’s creation was a "catastrophe," sparking outrage and calls for a boycott of the event by Israel's ambassador.

TITLE: Pacific Island leaders urge rich countries to do more to help control climate change
SUMMARY: Leaders and representatives from Pacific Island nations criticized the leaders of rich countries who aren't doing enough to control climate change.

TITLE: Finnish military training jet crashes, forcing pilots to eject
SUMMARY: A Finnish military jet crashed in the central part of the country on May 15, 2023. The pilots were forced to eject and are currently undergoing health checks.

TITLE: Nigerian Afrobeat star Seun Kuti arrested for allegedly assaulting a cop
SUMMARY: Seun Kuti, a Nigerian Afrobeat star, turned himself in for allegedly assaulting a cop by pushing the officer along a major road in the commercial hub of Lagos.

TITLE: European human rights summit to step up aid for Ukraine to counter Russian invasion
SUMMARY: The European human rights summit declared they would step up their aid for Ukraine to fight the Russian invasion. The two-day summit will include speeches and diplomatic networking.

TITLE: Vatican's Caritas Internationalis elects new leadership team after papal firings
SUMMARY: On Monday, a former Jesuit novice was elected secretary-general of the Vatican’s preeminent charity, Caritas Internationalis. The move comes after Pope Francis had fired past leadership in November.

TITLE: Belarusian opposition leader says ‘be well prepared’ amid Lukashenko illness rumors
SUMMARY: Opposition leader Svyatlana Tsikhanouskaya says everyone must "be well prepared" as illness rumors continue for Belarusian President Alexander Lukashenko.

TITLE: Herders in Kenya kill 10 lions, including Loonkiito, one of the country's oldest
SUMMARY: One of Kenya’s oldest wild lions was killed by herders. The government has expressed concern as six more lions were speared on Saturday, bringing to 10 the number killed last week.

TITLE: Nigerian chef cooks for over 4 days straight, breaks Guinness World Record
SUMMARY: Nigerian chef Hilda Baci has set a Guinness World Record for cooking nonstop for over four days, shattering her predecessor's 87-hour endeavor from 2019.

TITLE: Austrian authorities charge two with blasting Hitler speeches on train intercom
SUMMARY: Austrian authorities have charged two people for allegedly playing Hitler speeches on a train from Bregenz to Vienna, Austria, on Sunday.

TITLE: Girl wounded in Serbian school shooting has died, bringing death toll to 10
SUMMARY: A girl who has been in critical condition since the shooting attack at an elementary school on May 3 died on Monday. This death brings the death toll to 10.

TITLE: Ghanaian ex-president gets opposition party's nod in comeback bid
SUMMARY: Former Ghanaian President John Mahama has received the National Democratic Congress' nomination in his comeback bid for the West African nation's highest office.

TITLE: Senegalese police officer dead after clash with protestors gathered over opposition leader's arrest
SUMMARY: A police officer died and several protestors were injured following a clash at a demonstration over opposition leader Ousmane Sonko's arrest and rape trial.

TITLE: Canadian anti-capitalist cafe with 'pay what you can' model shutting down after one year
SUMMARY: A Canadian cafe with anti-capitalist views is shutting down after just over a year in business. The owner blamed "the lack of generational wealth/seed capital."

TITLE: Ukraine shoots down 18 Russian missiles aimed at capital of Kyiv
SUMMARY: Ukrainian forces shot down 18 of 18 missiles Russia fired at the capital of Kyiv on Tuesday, using U.S.-made Patriot missiles to bolster the city's defenses.

TITLE: Separatists fed up with Trudeau want province to break away from Canada, become 51st state
SUMMARY: A separatist group in Alberta, Canada, is aiming to educate Canadians in the province about the possibility of seceding from Canada to join the U.S. amid anger at the government.

TITLE: South Korean adoption agency ordered to compensate adoptee for mishandling his adoption to the US
SUMMARY: A 48-year-old man is suing the South Korean government and the country’s biggest adoption agency for mishandling his adoption to the U.S. in the first case of its kind.

TITLE: German court convicts 5 suspects in connection with Dresden museum jewelry heist
SUMMARY: Five suspects were arrested in connection with a jewelry heist at the Dresden museum. The suspects stole 21 pieces of jewelry containing over 4,300 diamonds.

TITLE: UK considers ‘fighter jet coalition’ with Ukraine as Zelenskyy meets with prime minister
SUMMARY: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy visited UK Prime Minister Rishi Sunak, seeking military aid and participation in a "fighter jet coalition."

TITLE: Putin gives church Russia’s most important icon after ‘numerous requests’
SUMMARY: President Vladimir Putin gifted one of Russia's most venerated images to the Russian Orthodox Church after "numerous requests," Patriarch Kirill announced.

TITLE: Canada's prime minister meets with South Korea's president, will discuss challenges posed by North Korea
SUMMARY: The president of South Korea was visited by Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau. The two leaders are expected to discuss the challenges posed by North Korea.

TITLE: 2 skeletons found buried in Pompeii reveal earthquakes accompanied eruption of Mount Vesuvius
SUMMARY: Earthquakes accompanied the eruption of Mount Vesuvius in Pompeii, Italy, according to evidence from two skeletons that were found buried beneath a collapsed wall.

TITLE: Hostel fire kills at least 6 in waterfront city as cops investigate possible arson
SUMMARY: The Loafers Lodge in Wellington, New Zealand, had no sprinklers, and officials have not yet determined if fire alarms went off as the blaze started shortly after midnight.

TITLE: South Africa admits US claims that arms were shipped to Russia ‘still stand’
SUMMARY: Washington, D.C., is still waiting for answers from South Africa on whether arms have been supplied to Russia, as a U.S. senator calls for reevaluating the relationship between the countries.

TITLE: Chinese Leader Xi Jinping's government shuts down advocacy group for LGBTQ community in Beijing
SUMMARY: The government of Chinese President Xi Jinping shut down an LGBTQ safe space in Beijing, China. In the past few years, the LGBTQ space has shrunk in China

TITLE: Former US Embassy employee arrested, held at same Moscow prison as WSJ reporter: Russian report
SUMMARY: Russian media reported Robert Shonov, a former employee of the U.S. Embassy in Russia, is being held on a conspiracy charge at Lefortovo Prison in Moscow.

TITLE: Rape trial for Senegal's main opposition leader postponed due to protests
SUMMARY: Ousmane Sonko, the main opposition leader in Senegal, had his rape trial postponed due to unrest linked to the case. Three people were killed in the unrest.

TITLE: 27 European Union countries adopt new rule banning sale of products that fuel deforestation
SUMMARY: New legislation formally adopted by European Union countries will help reduce the 27 countries' ties to deforestation. The new rules ban the sale of products that fuel deforestation.

TITLE: Early warning, preparedness likely saved thousands of lives during Cyclone Mocha
SUMMARY: Early warning and preparedness was likely the reason thousands of lives were saved during Cyclone Mocha. The cyclone hit Bangladesh and Myanmar over the weekend.

TITLE: Worldwide executions increased by 53% in 2022, rose in Iran, Saudi Arabia
SUMMARY: Amnesty International says executions worldwide increased by 53% in 2022 from a year earlier, with a significant rise in Iran and Saudi Arabia. Numbers in Saudi Arabia have tripled.

TITLE: English scrap metal recycler sentenced to 9 months in jail for 2016 wall collapse that killed 5
SUMMARY: The owner and a manager of a scrap metal recycling plant have been sentenced to nine months in jail for safety lapses after a wall collapsed and killed five migrant workers in 2016.

TITLE: Dozens protest in Tokyo to stop Japan from releasing treated, but still radioactive, water into the sea
SUMMARY: Anti-nuclear activists protested in Tokyo Tuesday to stop Japan from releasing radioactive water from a damaged Fukushima power plant and into the sea.

TITLE: Italian cocaine-sniffing dog finds 3 tons of drugs hidden in banana shipment
SUMMARY: Authorities and a police dog in Italy found more than three tons of cocaine hidden in a banana shipment from Ecuador. The shipment could have been worth $900 million in street sales.

TITLE: School bus and truck collision in Australia leaves 6 children seriously injured
SUMMARY: A school bus and truck collision in Australia left six children seriously injured on Tuesday. Police said the bus was carrying as many as 45 children when it tipped over after being hit.

TITLE: Israeli city Tel Aviv spots a rare, endangered seal sunbathing on a beach
SUMMARY: A rare and endangered seal has unexpectedly visited Israeli city Tel Aviv. The Mediterranean monk seal has caused media buzz after onlookers spotted the creature sunbathing on a beach.

TITLE: Argentine tourist dies after injuries sustained in Mexico machete attack
SUMMARY: An Argentinian tourist who was severely wounded in a May 12 machete attack in Mexico has died. The man died from his injuries at a hospital in Mexico City on Monday.

TITLE: CIA uses favored Russian Telegram app to recruit spies
SUMMARY: The CIA has launched a Telegram channel to recruit Russian spies disillusioned with the war in Ukraine and President Vladimir Putin. A video was posted Monday night.

TITLE: Tribes feuding over coal mine ownership kill 15 in remote northwest region
SUMMARY: Two tribes feuding over the ownership of a coal mine killed 15 people in the remote northwest region of Pakistan. The fighting erupted on Monday between the Sunny Khel and Zarghun Khel tribes.

TITLE: Burma recovering after deadly Cyclone Mocha; at least 21 dead, hundreds believed missing
SUMMARY: At least 21 are dead and hundreds believed to be missing in Burma on Tuesday after Cyclone Mocha barreled into the coastline with 130 mph winds on Sunday.

TITLE: Italian flooding forces residents to rooftops, Venetian authorities prepare to activate barrier in lagoon
SUMMARY: Authorities in Venice are preparing to activate a mobile barrier meant to combat flooding. Residents in some Italian towns were forced to rooftops to evade the floods.

TITLE: 'Injured and exhausted' dog rescued from England's highest mountain
SUMMARY: The Keswick Mountain Rescue Team saved an "injured and exhausted" dog that had scaled Scafell Pike in northwest England's Lake District National Park.

TITLE: Slovak zookeeper found dead in enclosure after apparent lion attack
SUMMARY: Authorities in Slovakia are investigating the apparent mauling of a zookeeper by a lion he kept. The man was found dead in an animal enclosure.

TITLE: China listed as a top offender in annual State Department freedom of religion report
SUMMARY: A new State Department report on religious freedoms finds China is one of the worst offenders worldwide. Other countries including Iran, North Korea, Afghanistan and India.

TITLE: Jewel thieves get short jail stint after museum heist worth over $100 million
SUMMARY: The Green Vault collection in Dresden contained diamond-encrusted items commissioned by Augustus the Strong as part of a rivalry with French King Louis XIV.

TITLE: Alleged Turkish drone strike targets Yazidi militant group in Iraq’s Sinjar
SUMMARY: An alleged Turkish drone strike targeted a Yazidi militant group in Iraq’s Sinjar on Tuesday. Officials reported that three militants were killed in the attack, and one was wounded.

TITLE: Chicken loose on subway tracks halts service in Mexico City
SUMMARY: Service was temporarily stopped Monday in Mexico City's subway system after a chicken got loose on the tracks. One of the workers tossed his coat over the animal.

TITLE: Pakistani officer accused of shooting at girls' school bus, killing 8-year-old
SUMMARY: Pakistani police officer Alam Khan has been arrested for opening fire on a bus at a girls' school he was tasked with guarding, injuring five people and killing an eight-year-old girl.

TITLE: Gunmen kill 29 villagers in latest attack in hard-hit north Nigeria
SUMMARY: Authorities and residents in north-central Nigeria said gunmen killed 29 people during a late-night attack in Plateau state. The attacks targeted remote communities in the nation.

TITLE: Cyprus freezes $1.3B in Russian-owned assets
SUMMARY: The Cypriot government has frozen 1.2 billion Euros ($1.3 billion) in Russian-owned assets managed by companies registered to operate in Cyprus.

TITLE: French first lady's relative attacked as Macron doubles down on pension reform
SUMMARY: French first lady Brigitte Macron issued a public statement condemning a politically-motivated attack on her great-nephew, Jean-Baptiste Trogneux.

TITLE: 2 US consulate staffers, 2 policemen in Nigeria shot, killed in attack on convoy
SUMMARY: An attack on a US convoy killed two consulate staffers and two policemen in Nigeria, authorities said Tuesday.

TITLE: 1-year-old dead, 23 missing after Malawi hippopotamus attack
SUMMARY: A one-year-old child was killed, 13 people were rescued and 23 others remain missing after a hippopotamus capsized a canoe in southern Malawi.

TITLE: Company uses AI to help manufacturers map 'ethical' supply chains, but warns 'its not a magic wand'
SUMMARY: Software company FRDM uses "social listening," which tracks brand conversations and trends, to track instances of human rights abuses and map ethical supply chain issues.

TITLE: Nepal Sherpa guide sets record for most climbs of Mount Everest with 27
SUMMARY: Nepal Sherpa guide Kami Rita reached the 29,032-foot summit of Mount Everest, the world’s tallest mountain, for a record 27th time on Wednesday.

TITLE: 'Truly sorry': Church of England apologizes after mishandling of clerical sex abuse comes to light
SUMMARY: An Anglican bishop has said the Church of England is "truly sorry" for how the clergy handled allegations of clerical sexual abuse against a 16-year-old boy in the 1980s.

TITLE: Russian losses in Ukraine surpass 200,000: Ukraine intel
SUMMARY: The Russian death toll in Ukraine has climbed, with more than 200,000 troops being reported as "liquidated" by Ukraine's armed forces.

TITLE: Company uses AI to help manufacturers map 'ethical' supply chains, but warns 'it's not a magic wand'
SUMMARY: Software company FRDM uses "social listening," which tracks brand conversations and trends, to track instances of human rights abuses and map ethical supply chain issues.

TITLE: Retired U.S. Special Forces member killed by Russian mercenaries in Ukraine
SUMMARY: Retired Green Beret Nicholas Maimer was reportedly killed by Russian mercenary forces in Ukraine this week, and the Wagner Group gloated over his death.

TITLE: Danish Supreme Court rules newspaper did not violate copyright of Copenhagen’s The Little Mermaid statue
SUMMARY: The Danish Supreme Court ruled that a newspaper did not violate the copyright of Copenhagen’s The Little Mermaid statue by publishing a cartoon of it as a zombie.

TITLE: Ex-French President Nicolas Sarkozy to wear electronic bracelet for a year after losing corruption appeal
SUMMARY: Former French President Nicolas Sarkozy was denied his appeal of a conviction on corruption and influence peddling charges and sentenced to serve time at home.

TITLE: North Korea looks to the final frontier as Kim Jong Un readies launch of spy satellite
SUMMARY: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un inspected a completed military spy satellite this week as concerns mount a launch will come in the next few weeks.

TITLE: US issues new travel warnings for summer hotspots in Caribbean, South America
SUMMARY: The State Department issued warnings for seven countries, five of which are in the Caribbean or South America, over concerns of elevated crime and safety for Americans abroad.

TITLE: Pakistan's former Prime Minister Imran Khan says police are surrounding his home
SUMMARY: Imran Khan tweeted that he could be arrested and police have been surrounding his house. Imran Khan is the former prime minister of Pakistan.

TITLE: Flooding in northern Italy kill at least 8, forces thousands to be evacuated
SUMMARY: Flooding in northern Italy has killed at least eight people as rain continues to pour. Thousands of others were forced to evacuate due to the heavy rains.

TITLE: Russian court orders arrest of prominent film producer, theater director for criticizing war in Ukraine
SUMMARY: Film producer Alexander Rodnyansky and theater director Ivan Vyrypaev were ordered to be arrested in Russia for "spreading false information" about the Russian army.

TITLE: Searing Asian heat wave was substantially more likely due to climate change, according to study
SUMMARY: A study released by international scientists on May 17, 2023, claimed the heat wave in southern Asia was made 30 times more likely by climate change.

TITLE: Palestinian militants fire rocket into Israel just hours after agreeing to cease-fire
SUMMARY: Palestinian militants shattered a cease-fire with Israel just hours after coming to the Saturday agreement, launching a rocket into southern Israel Sunday.

TITLE: Chinese fishing boat capsizes in the middle of the Indian Ocean, 39 reported missing
SUMMARY: A Chinese fishing boat carrying 17 people from China, 17 from Indonesia, and five from the Philippines has capsized in the middle of the Indian Ocean northwest of Australia.

TITLE: Bodies of Chinese couple found naked and bloddy in Bali hotel, Indonesian police say
SUMMARY: Indonesian police investigating the deaths of a Chinese couple found at a Bali hotel may have been a homicide-suicide. Authorities suspect the boyfriend tortured his girlfriend.

TITLE: Over 100 schools in Serbia receive bomb threats following mass shooting at an elementary school
SUMMARY: Over a hundred schools in Serbia were warned that explosive devices have been allegedly planted around the buildings following two mass shootings that occurred earlier this month.

TITLE: UAE court orders British trader who orchestrated $1.7 billion tax fraud to repay Denmark's tax authority
SUMMARY: Financier Sanjay Shah, a British hedge fund trader who orchestrated a $1.7 billion tax fraud, has been ordered to pay that amount to Denmark's tax authority.

TITLE: Singapore hangs citizen for trafficking 3.3 pounds of cannabis
SUMMARY: Singapore has hung its second citizen in the last three weeks for trafficking cannabis. The 37-year-old man smuggled 3.3 pounds of drugs in 2019.

TITLE: Sanction busting new Iran-Russia intercontinental railroad agreement seeks to take on Suez Canal
SUMMARY: Russia and Iran inked an agreement to finance a $1.7 billion rail system to connect a major global trade network amid international sanctions.

TITLE: UK, Germany pressure US to decide on F-16 fighter jets for Ukraine
SUMMARY: Leaders from the UK and Germany said the US needs to decide on whether to allow the supply of F-16 warplanes to Ukraine as an international coalition forms.

TITLE: New Zealand police believe hostel fire to be arson; homicide investigation launched
SUMMARY: New Zealand police have launched a homicide investigation Wednesday into a fire that killed at least six people in a Wellington hostel that they believe was arson.

TITLE: Russia agrees to extend Ukraine grain deal to boost global food security
SUMMARY: Russia has agreed to extend a deal that allows Ukraine to ship grain to boost global food security. They will be able to ship grain via the Black Sea to parts of the world that are facing hunger.

TITLE: El Salvador sends troops to surround town after national police officer killed
SUMMARY: El Salvador has sent over 5,000 soldiers and 500 police to a small town after President Nayib Bukele said gang members killed a member of the national police.

TITLE: Britain baffled by shocking surge in death rates last year with no clear cause
SUMMARY: The first few months of 2022 recorded below-average excess deaths before seeing a spike that went above the five-year average in by tens of thousands of deaths.

TITLE: Belarus-Russia border checks implemented for first time since 1995
SUMMARY: Belarus, a close Russian ally, has partially restored security measures along the two Eastern European countries' 770-mile border.

TITLE: Africa's Sahel region seeks aid to fight violent extremism, stop its spread
SUMMARY: Africa’s Sahel region has become a hot spot for violent extremism, but the joint force set up in 2014 to combat groups linked to the Islamic State, al-Qaida and others has failed to stop their advances.

TITLE: Thai police arrest 2nd teenager for defaming monarchy amid renewed debate over rigorous law
SUMMARY: Officials in Thailand charged a 16-year-old girl with defaming the monarchy for messages she posted on Facebook two years ago, adding to the debate about the law allowing her arrest.

TITLE: Turkey protests as German police search homes of 2 journalists working for a Turkish newspaper
SUMMARY: German authorities seized electronic storage media during a home search of two journalists working for a Turkish newspaper, sparking protest from the Turkish Foreign Ministry.

TITLE: Nearly 50 migrants kidnapped by gang in northern Mexico
SUMMARY: Mexico's president and police announced Wednesday that nearly 50 migrants have been kidnapped by a gang in northern Mexico, the latest in a series of mass abductions.

TITLE: Death toll in Malawi hippo attack up to 7, 17 still missing
SUMMARY: Six more bodies, including those of two teenagers, were found floating in Malawi's Shire River on Wednesday, raising the total death toll from a hippopotamus attack on a canoe to seven.

TITLE: Former Bosnia wartime prison guard who settled in US faces federal charges
SUMMARY: Federal prosecutors said a former guard at a notorious Bosnia-Herzegovina prison camp who used a fabricated story to obtain refugee status in the U.S. has been arrested on fraud.

TITLE: Hamas calls on Palestinians to confront Israeli victory parade in Jerusalem
SUMMARY: The Hamas militant group in the Gaza Strip called on Palestinians Wednesday to confront a parade planned by Jewish nationalists through the main Palestinian road in Jerusalem’s Old City.

TITLE: Colombia plane crash:  Four child survivors found in Amazon rainforest two weeks later
SUMMARY: Four children missing after a plane crash in Colombia's Amazon Rainforest have been found, the country's president said.

TITLE: Ecuadorian president invokes 'nuclear option,' disbands legislature after attempted ouster
SUMMARY: Embattled Ecuadorian President Guillermo Lasso, one of Latin America's only conservative leaders, has disbanded the nation's legislature after it attempted to remove him from office.

TITLE: Biden embarks on abbreviated overseas trip as debt ceiling deadline looms
SUMMARY: President Biden's planned overseas trip will be cut short. The president will attend the G-7 summit in Japan but won't make planned stops in Papua New Guinea and Australia.

TITLE: China boasts spy crafts could be used as weapons against enemies: report
SUMMARY: While the U.S. is desperately trying to brush China’s spy balloon activities under the carpet, Chinese government sources laid out plans for using balloons as offensive weapons.

TITLE: In Nepal, 84-year-old man attempting to become oldest successful climber gets rescued after getting injured
SUMMARY: An 84-year-old Spanish man became injured while attempting to become the oldest climber to summit all the world’s highest mountains. He was rescued from Mount Dhaulagiri in Nepal.

TITLE: French high court issues decision supporting AI-powered surveillance cameras for Paris Olympics
SUMMARY: The French Constitutional Council backed a new law clearing the use of AI-powered surveillance cameras during the 2024 Paris Olympics, on Wednesday.

TITLE: State Dept. promises to punish North Korea if illicit satellite is launched
SUMMARY: The U.S. State Department has threatened to take further steps to punish North Korea if the rogue nation goes through with its planned spy satellite launch.

TITLE: British MP compared to Putin for saying traditional marriage 'only possible basis' for 'successful society'
SUMMARY: Conservative MP Danny Kruger drew condemnation and was likened to Russian President Vladimir Putin for claiming traditional marriage "is the only possible basis for a safe and successful society."

TITLE: China says Ukraine envoy met with Zelenskyy during talks in Kyiv
SUMMARY: China says its special envoy met with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy during talks in Kyiv this week. The visit followed a phone call between Zelenskyy and Xi Jinping.

TITLE: Lesotho imposes nationwide curfew in attempt to curb violent crime
SUMMARY: Officials in the small African kingdom of Lesotho imposed an indefinite curfew nationwide in an attempt to stop violent crime after the death of a prominent journalist.

TITLE: Rescue crews in Italy work to reach isolated towns following heavy flooding
SUMMARY: Cleanup and reconstruction plans have begun in Italy following massive rains and flooding. Rescue crews are working to reach northern towns that were cut off from highways and service.

TITLE: US issues new travel warnings for summer hotspots in Caribbean, South America
SUMMARY: The State Department issued warnings for seven countries, five of which are in the Caribbean or South America, over concerns of elevated crime and safety for Americans abroad.

TITLE: India’s top court allows bull-taming sport to continue despite criticism from animal rights groups
SUMMARY: India’s top court has allowed bull-taming sport of jallikattu, to continue despite criticism from animal rights groups. Jallikattu is celebrated as cultural heritage in Tamil Nadu.

TITLE: South Korea signs $130M financial package for Ukraine
SUMMARY: South Korea signed a $130 million financial aid package for Ukraine as it continues to fight Russian forces. South Korea said it is not providing lethal weapons to Ukraine.

TITLE: Death toll in north Nigeria attack tops 80; 7 suspects arrested
SUMMARY: The number of people killed after an attack in north central Nigeria’s Plateau state earlier this week has reached 80, with people still missing days after the violence.

TITLE: UK, Norway sign deal to counter undersea threats from Russian spy ring
SUMMARY: Great Britain and Norway have partnered to counter Russian threats to underwater infrastructure. The two allies met in the U.K. to discuss the ongoing threat from Moscow.

TITLE: Convoy ambush in eastern Congo kills 4, including 3 park rangers
SUMMARY: A Congolese conservation group said that four people died and six others were injured Thursday when their convoy was ambushed by gunmen in Virunga National Park.

TITLE: Driver apprehended after speeding through Vatican gate, reaching San Damaso Courtyard
SUMMARY: A car driven by a suspect believed to be mentally ill drove through one of the Vatican's entrance gates Wednesday night, and was shot at by gendarmes before the driver was apprehended.

TITLE: Chinese comedian arrested after joking about country's military: report
SUMMARY: A stand-up comedian was reportedly arrested and charged for making a joke about the Chinese military. The company that hired him was also reportedly fined.

TITLE: US walks back claim it killed major al Qaeda leader in drone strike
SUMMARY: A man killed in a U.S. drone strike, initially thought to be a senior al Qaeda leader, was actually a poor father of 10 who has spent his life in poverty, according to his family.

TITLE: Wuhan University rule-breaking with AI-controlled satellite experiments: experts
SUMMARY: China may see artificial intelligence as the key tool that can help elevate its forces and allow it to leapfrog the United States for clear superiority, an expert warned.

TITLE: Japan G-7 Summit: 'Critical' meeting for top powers with Russia, China focus
SUMMARY: President Biden will have a key opportunity to bring a number of top countries, including Asian partners, in line on issues surrounding China and Russia.

TITLE: Australian police use stun gun on 95-year-old woman with dementia who approached them with knife
SUMMARY: Australian police used a stun gun on a 95-year-old woman with dementia who was approaching them with a knife. She was sent to the hospital in critical condition.

TITLE: Tourist shot to death in popular Mexican resort town days after another tourist killed in machete attack
SUMMARY: A tourist from Canada was killed in Mexico just days after an Argentinian tourist was killed in the same coastal state that is generally considered one of the safer areas.

TITLE: Mexican volcano known as 'El Popo' rumbles canceling schools in area, 22 million at risk
SUMMARY: "El Popo," a volcano in Popocatepetl, Mexico, rumbled this week. Scientists have been watching the volcano's every move. It is a threat to 22 million people.

TITLE: Sudan's top army general fires former deputy turned paramilitary leader in symbolic gesture
SUMMARY: Sudan's top army general fired Gen. Abdel Fattah Burhan, the former deputy of the country's governing body who is now a paramilitary leader, in a symbolic gesture.

TITLE: 11 dead in China-Vietnam border road accident linked to human trafficking
SUMMARY: A road incident where a vehicle overturned along the border of China and Vietnam has led to the deaths of 11 people. Authorities said the incident was related to human trafficking.

TITLE: British mountain guide scales Everest for 17th time, breaking record for most ascents by non-Sherpa guide
SUMMARY: Kenton Cool, a British mountain climber, scaled Mount Everest for the 17th time. He broke his own record for the most ascents of Everest by a non-Sherpa guide.

TITLE: Direct flights resume between Russia and Georgia despite rocky relations between the nations
SUMMARY: Russia unexpectedly lifted the four-year flight ban with Georgia. Georgians gathered at the country's airport to protest the first flight to arrive from Russia.

TITLE: Suspected Haitian gang members set police vehicle on fire, killing officer
SUMMARY: A Haitian police car was set on fire by a group of suspected gang members. One Haitian police officer was killed in the latest attack against the country's police force.

TITLE: Urgent funding is needed to avert catastrophic hunger in northeast Nigeria
SUMMARY: The United Nations office in Nigeria says at least $396 million is needed to prevent widespread malnutrition and hunger caused by the security crisis in northeastern Nigeria.

TITLE: German doctor convicted over threat by fairy tale loses appeal
SUMMARY: A German doctor convicted of threatening a woman by emailing her an extract from a fairy tale has been rejected for an appeal. The doctor deliberately threatened the employee with death.

TITLE: Object that entered Polish airspace identified as Russian-made rocket
SUMMARY: A Polish official said an object that entered Poland's airspace in 2022 has been identified as a Russian-made rocket. The rocket was made of concrete and is being examined.

TITLE: Spanish towns evacuated as intentional wildfire tears through western part of country
SUMMARY: Towns in western Spain were evacuated as a wildfire tore through the region. Authorities suspect the fire started intentionally since two separate blazes erupted simultaneously.

TITLE: Biden admin reveals plan to train Ukraine pilots on F-16s, 'will decide' when, who will provide jets
SUMMARY: The Biden administration has resisted providing Ukraine with F-16 warplanes, but may now simply step aside as other countries with access to such planes look to provide them.

TITLE: New Zealand, islands hit with small tsunami caused by 7.7 magnitude earthquake
SUMMARY: A small tsunami caused by a 7.7 magnitude earthquake has hit the islands of the South Pacific and New Zealand. The threat passed in a few hours and no damage has been reported.

TITLE: Iran defies US over executions, putting three democracy protesters to death
SUMMARY: The Islamic Republic of Iran continues targeting protesters who took to the streets after the regime murdered a young Iranian-Kurdish woman for failing to cover her hair.

TITLE: German surgeon fired for enlisting help from hospital cleaner to amputate toe
SUMMARY: A surgeon at the Mainz University Hospital in Germany has been fired after having a hospital cleaner with no medical experience assist in a toe amputation.

TITLE: Zimbabwe releases over 4,000 prisoners under amnesty to reduce overcrowding
SUMMARY: Zimbabwe released over 4,000 prisoners under a presidential amnesty in order to ease overcrowding in jails. Former inmates have complained about harsh conditions in jails.

TITLE: Slovak court acquits businessman in retrial over 2018 murder of journalist
SUMMARY: A businessman who was accused of masterminding the 2018 killing of an investigative journalist and his fiancée has been acquitted for a second time by a court in Slovakia.

TITLE: Dozens injured in Thailand tourist hot spot after speedboat slams into concrete post
SUMMARY: At least 36 people were injured, some of them seriously, after a speedboat in Thailand crashed into a concrete post in an incident where the captain may have fallen asleep.

TITLE: Biden administration reveals plan to train Ukraine pilots on F-16s, 'will decide' when, who will provide jets
SUMMARY: The Biden administration has resisted providing Ukraine with F-16 warplanes but may now step aside as other countries with access to the planes consider providing them.

TITLE: Greenpeace targeted in Russian dissent crackdown, top anti-Putin politician spared jail time
SUMMARY: While Russia has declared Greenpeace a national security threat for its pro-Ukraine advocacy, a top anti-Putin politician, Yevgeny Roizman, was spared a prison sentence.

TITLE: Serbian leadership holds rally in defiance of mass gun violence protests
SUMMARY: Right-wing Serbian President Aleksandar Vucic's party organized a rally and counter-protest in defiance of thousands of anti-government marchers protesting over two recent shootings.

TITLE: Child accidentally hangs herself in amusement park inflatable while staff stared at phones: Report
SUMMARY: A Ukrainian child died of strangulation after she got stuck inside an inflatable trampoline while employees allegedly watched and didn't do anything.

TITLE: Obama, Colbert now among 500 Americans banned from Russia
